
```{r}
# Load necessary libraries
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
library(lubridate)

# Example: Replace these IDs with actual ORCID and Scholar IDs
publications <- get_publications("0000-0003-2531-9408", "Gcz8Ng0AAAAJ")


# Visualization 1: Top 10 Most Frequent Journals

# Summarize the number of publications per journal
journal_frequencies <- publications %>%
  group_by(journal_name) %>%
  summarise(publication_count = n()) %>%
  arrange(desc(publication_count)) %>%
  head(5)  # Select the top 10 journals

# Create the bar chart for the top 10 most frequent journals
ggplot(journal_frequencies, aes(x = reorder(journal_name, publication_count), y = publication_count)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity", fill = "coral") +
  labs(title = "Top 10 Most Frequent Journals",
       x = "Journal Name",
       y = "Number of Publications") +
  coord_flip() +  # Flip the axes for better readability
  theme_minimal()
```
